newsitem.title: CANADA: Atlantis says sci-fi series to reach 95 pct of U.S.
newsitem.headline: Atlantis says sci-fi series to reach 95 pct of U.S.

text.p: Atlantis Communications Inc on Tuesday said its new science-fiction series, which was conceived by Star Trek creator Gene Roddenberry, will be available to 95 percent of U.S. television-watching households.
Atlantis also said it has renamed the series "Gene Roddenberry's Earth: Final Conflict" and signed actor Kevin Kilner to head the cast of the hour-long program.
The series, which had been titled "Gene Roddenberry's Battleground Earth" revolves around the arrival on earth of aliens who are believed by some to have a dark, hidden agenda.

The series is being syndicated in the U.S. by a unit of Tribune Co, which is also helping to develop and produce the program. The initial season of 22 hour-long episodes of the program will reach the top 50 television markets in the U.S., Atlantis said.

Atlantis earlier this month reached an agreement to sell video rights and TV rights to the series for most parts of the world outside North America to Polygram Filmed Entertainment . In Canada, the series has been licensed to Baton Broadcasting Inc.
The series will begin production in Toronto on May 21, 1997 for an early Fall launch.

"The reason that this one (series) is particularly ambitious for us is the potential for merchandising and licensing agreements if the show is a success," said Jeremy Katz, vice-president of production and publicity with Atlantis. The company has retained merchandise rights for the series outside of the U.S. market.
Atlantis shares were down C$0.25 to C$8.75 in mid-afternoon trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange.
